tit.e: Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (Yamashiro Kokuzo)
Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (Yamashiro Kokuzo)

sen.j: 山背国造・山代国造（やましろのくにのみやつこ・やましろこくぞう)は山城国南西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (Yamashiro Kokuzo, written as 山背国造 or 山代国造) was a kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) who ruled the south-west part of Yamashiro Province.
Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (Yamashiro Kokuzo, written as 山背国造 or 山代国造) was a kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) who ruled the south-west part of Yamashiro Province.
Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (also known as Yamashiro Kokuzo, written as 山背国造 or 山代国造) was a kuninomiyatsuko (provincial governor) who ruled the south-west part of Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: ただし、山城国造は後世の混同と思われる。
sen.e: However, Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko written as 山城国造 seems to be a confusion in later years.
However, Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko written as 山城国造 seems to have caused confusion years later.
However, Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko written as 山城国造 seems to have caused confusion years later.

sen.j: 天津日子根命または伊岐志邇保命。
sen.e: A descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto or Ikishiniho-no-mikoto.
A descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto or Ikishiniho-no-mikoto.
A descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto or Ikishiniho-no-mikoto.

sen.j: 天津彦根命であれば、凡河内国造である凡河内氏と同系。
sen.e: If the kuninomiyatsuko was a descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto, it belongs to the same line of the Oshikochi clan, who held the position of Oshikochi no Kuni no Miyatsuko.
If the kuninomiyatsuko was a descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto, they belong to the same line of the Oshikochi clan, who held the position of Oshikochi no Kuni no Miyatsuko.
If the kuninomiyatsuko was a descendant of Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto, they belong to the same line of the Oshikochi clan, who held the position of Oshikochi no Kuni no Miyatsuko.

sen.j: 神武天皇朝に阿多根命が、成務朝に曾能振命が山代(山背)国造に任じられたとされるが、神武朝の設置は疑わしい。
sen.e: It is said that Atane-no-mikoto and Sonofuri-no-mikoto were appointed as Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko during the Emperor Jinmu's era and the Emperor Seimu's era respectively, appointment in the Emperor Jinmu's era is questionable.

It is said that Atane-no-mikoto and Sonofuri-no-mikoto were appointed as Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko during the Emperor Jinmu's era and the Emperor Seimu's era respectively, appointment in the Emperor Jinmu's era is questionable.

It is said that Atane-no-mikoto and Sonofuri-no-mikoto were appointed as Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko during the Emperor Jinmu's era and the Emperor Seimu's era respectively, appointment in the Emperor Jinmu's era is questionable.

tit.cmt: 氏族はclanとなっているようですが、後列では「うじ」「かばね」について説明しているようです。

sen.j: 山代(山背)氏。
sen.e: The uji was Yamashiro (the Yamashiro clan).
The uji was Yamashiro (the Yamashiro clan).
The uji was Yamashiro (the Yamashiro clan).

sen.j: 後に山氏。
sen.e: Later, the uji was changed to Yama (the Yama clan).
sen.cmt: 山氏：ビジネス・科学技術 / 京都プロジェクト案件 用語共有の表現を転用しています。
sen.e: Later, the uji was changed to Yama (the Yama clan).
Later, the uji was changed to Yama (the Yama clan).

sen.j: 姓は直。
sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) was Atae.
sen.cmt: 直：以下を参考としています。http://aries.hp.infoseek.co.jp/myouji/kiso/kabane.html
sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) was Atae.
The kabane (hereditary title) was Atae.

sen.j: 天武天皇12年(683年)に連に、14年に忌寸に昇格した。
sen.e: Promoted to muraji in 683, and to imiki in 685.
Promoted to muraji in 683, and to imiki in 685.
Promoted to muraji in 683, and to imiki in 685.

sen.j: 一部の者は天長10年(833年)に宿禰を賜っている。
sen.e: Some members were granted the rank of sukune in 833.
Some members were granted the rank of sukune in 833.
Some members were granted the rank of sukune in 833.

sen.j: 同氏には魯の白竜王を祖とする渡来系氏族や、火明命を祖とする別系もある。
sen.e: The clan has branch lines such as immigrant clans that derived from King Bailong of Lu, and other lines that derived from Hoakari.
The clan has branch lines such as immigrant clans that derived from King Bailong of Lu, and other lines that derived from Hoakari.
The clan has branch lines such as immigrant clans that derived from King Bailong of Lu, and other lines that derived from Hoakari.

sen.j: 山城国(もとは山背国)。
sen.e: Yamashiro Province (originally written as 山背国).
Yamashiro Province (originally written as 山背国).
Yamashiro Province (originally written as 山背国).

sen.j: 現在の京都府南部。
sen.e: It was located in the present-day southern part of Kyoto.
It was located in the present-day southern part of Kyoto.
It was located in the present-day southern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 北部に山代国造が、南部に山背国造が並立していたという説もある。
sen.e: One theory has it that Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山代国造) in the northern part and Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山背国造) in the southern part coexisted.
One theory has it that Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山代国造) in the northern part and Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山背国造) in the southern part coexisted.
One theory has it that Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山代国造) in the northern part and Yamashiro no Kuni no Miyatsuko (山背国造) in the southern part coexisted.

sen.j: 山氏は摂津国河辺郡為奈郷に居住した。
sen.e: The Yama clan lived in Ina-go, Kawabe County in Settsu Province.
The Yama clan lived in Ina-go, Kawabe County in Settsu Province.
The Yama clan lived in Ina-go, Kawabe County in Settsu Province.

tit.e: Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)

sen.j: 不明。
sen.e: Unknown.
Unknown.
Unknown.

sen.j: 天津彦根命を祭る山城国内の神社としては、小倉神社(京都府大山崎町)や祝園神社(京都府精華町)などがあるが、後者は奈良時代の創立。
sen.e: Shrines in Yamashiro Province that enshrine Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto include Ogura-jinja Shrine (Oyamazaki Machi, Kyoto Prefecture) and Hosono-jinja Shrine (Seika-cho, Kyoto Prefecture), the latter of which founded in the Nara period.

Shrines in Yamashiro Province that enshrine Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto include Ogura-jinja Shrine (Oyamazaki Machi, Kyoto Prefecture) and Hosono-jinja Shrine (Seika-cho, Kyoto Prefecture), the latter of which was founded in the Nara period.

Shrines in Yamashiro Province that enshrine Amatsuhikone-no-mikoto include Ogura-jinja Shrine (Oyamazaki Machi, Kyoto Prefecture) and Hosono-jinja Shrine (Seika-cho, Kyoto Prefecture), the latter of which was founded in the Nara period.

sen.j: 山背根子 …… 古墳時代の伝説上の人。
sen.e: Neko YAMASHIRO: A legendary figure who lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period).
Neko YAMASHIRO: A legendary figure who lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period).
Neko YAMASHIRO: A legendary figure who lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 山氏の祖。
sen.e: The ancestor of the Yama clan.
The ancestor of the Yama clan.
The ancestor of the Yama clan.

sen.j: 神功皇后の命で広田神社を祭った葉山媛と長田神社を祭った長媛の父。
sen.e: He was the father of Hayama-hime, who established Hirota-jinja Shrine under the order of the Empress Jingu, and Nagahime (長媛), who established Nagata-jinja Shrine.
He was the father of Hayama-hime, who established Hirota-jinja Shrine under the order of the Empress Jingu, and Nagahime (長媛), who established Nagata-jinja Shrine.
He was the father of Hayama-hime, who established Hirota-jinja Shrine under the order of the Empress Jingu, and Nagahime (長媛), who established Nagata-jinja Shrine.
